column4: i used ssh to access my server before, i just reinstalled ubuntu on my server, now its saying that the RSA keys may be wrong (something about attmpted man in the middle attack), how do i dump the old keys so i can get the new ones?
remove the entry for that host from ~/.ssh/known_hosts
im guessing i dont just vim it?
no, just anything related to that host.
i only have a bunch of letters that make no sense currnelty
do you have a lot of host keys in there?
if not, then just delete the .ssh/known_hosts file
there's probably a better way to do it, but looking at my known_hosts file, i can't see the hostnames or ips in it ... must be something new
where are the nameserver entries keeped in ubuntu?
where are the nameserver entries keeped in ubuntu??????????????????
same place they are on most other unix: /etc/resolv.conf
